thread.title: People Are Freaking Out Over Finding a Bay Leaf In Their Chipotle - Thrillist
thread.title_full: People Are Freaking Out Over Finding a Bay Leaf In Their Chipotle - Thrillist

author: Dustin Nelson
title: People Are Freaking Out Over Finding a Bay Leaf In Their Chipotle - Thrillist
text: — A A Ron (@AaronM5959) December 19, 2016 @ChipotleTweets hi yes is this an extremely large basil leaf or is this an actual leaf in my food pic.twitter.com/EVcjasZXA7 — Miranda Lobus (@mlobusss_) December 19, 2016 @ChipotleTweets Thank you for the leaf. Just what I wanted. #WONTCOMEBACK #GOBILLS pic.twitter.com/idSXp7VlEK — Bryan Jost (@Real_BryanJost) December 28, 2016 While a lot of the complainers are getting flak for not recognizing a bay leaf, the bay leaves should not be in the food. But to be fair, people are maybe a little on edge of so many weird allegations and reports coming out of Chipotle involving e. coli , chicken feet , inaccurate calorie counts , and a founder saying he's not satisfied with the chain's customer service. There's a delicate line to walk for the people running Chipotle's Twitter. They have to kindly let people know it's an ingredient not the result of an open window in the kitchen. They also need to say sorry, because, you know, it's not supposed to be there. Though, calling them edible is charitable. Bay leaves aren't technically poisonous, but they're quite rigid and can hurt going down. @6HayleyGavica9 I'm sorry. That's a bay leaf from our rice recipe. We do our best to remove them before service, but sometimes on gets thru.
